snippet: Interfaith Medical Center, serving Bedford-Stuyvesant and Crown Heights, has been in and out of financial trouble for decades.
abstract: Interfaith Medical Center in Brooklyn is planning to declare bankruptcy, raising concerns that New York State may force the hospital, which has been in and out of financial trouble for decades, to close or merge with another institution.
lead_paragraph: Interfaith Medical Center, serving Bedford-Stuyvesant and Crown Heights, has been in and out of financial trouble for decades.

headline.seo: Interfaith Medical Center in Brooklyn Plans to Declare Bankruptcy
headline.main: Leery of a Merger, a Hospital in Brooklyn Plans to Declare Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: Leery of a Merger, a Hospital in Brooklyn Plans to Declare Bankruptcy
